intro: Crepis hispidula, commonly known as the hispid mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and often have a lobed or toothed appearance, while the flowers are small and yellowish. Crepis hispidula is often used in ecological studies due to its role in supporting pollinators and its adaptability to various habitats.
